content: cute cane handle cover hook - 3 5mm yarn - #3 light weight gauge - 19w x 21h in single_crochet 4 x4 square stitches - chain chain slip_stitch sl single_crochet us single_crochet increase increase decrease decrease materials - scrap light weight yarn about 10-20g darning needle scissors crochet hook stitch marker opt skills needed - chain stitch slip_stitch single crochet us how to increase how to decrease tips - soft slightly stretchy yarn is great for this project because it needs to slip over either end of a t-shape cane handle if you or your loved one has any issues with certain materials be sure to use a yarn that will accommodate these issues i would not use wool for this project in case the yarn gets wet and shrinks i like using an acrylic cotton or blended baby yarn that will dry quickly time to crochet row 1 chain 27 and sl together to form a ring chain 1 and single_crochet into the ring single_crochet until you have 27 stitches in the row the next row will be worked in the round 27 stitches row 2-10 skip the chain stitch from the previous row and work into the first single_crochet in the row single_crochet around until you reach the end of row 10 turn the work right side out around row 3 it may be helpful to use a stitch marker to help keep track of stitches row 11 you will begin increasing in this row increase in the next stitch single_crochet around 13x 15 stitches total increase single_crochet around 12x 14 stitches total 29 stitches row 12 increase in the next stitch single_crochet around 14x 16 stitches increase single_crochet around 15x to counteract tilt 17 stitches 31 stitches row 13 chain 15 then single_crochet into the 16th stitch in the row single_crochet around the rest of the row 31 stitches row 14 single_crochet around the row be sure to count your stitches for the chain section from the previous row you should have 15 single_crochet in this section 31 stitches row 15 you will begin decreasing in this row decrease in the next stitch single_crochet around 13x 14 stitches decrease single_crochet around 14x 15 stitches 29 stitches row 16 decrease in the next stitch single_crochet 12x around 13 stitches decrease single_crochet 13x around 14 stitches plus one more single_crochet if you are using a stitch marker move your stitch marker to your new stitch this is the new start of your row this counteracts the tilt row 17-26 single_crochet around the row finishing off with a sl in the last stitch at row 26 weave in ends 27 stitches voila your new cane handle cover should slip over most canes with a t-shape handle if one end of the handle is thicker than the other i recommend slipping it over that section first happy crocheting
